definition: to do harm to/to cause trouble to/harm/evil/calamity
to talk drivel/to assert sth without a proper understanding or basis in fact/not to know what one is talking about
to make a wild guess/blind guess
lit. to direct blindly/to issue confused orders/to give contradictory directions
to lie through one's teeth (idiom)/to talk drivel
pinyin: zheng1 zhe5 yan3 jing1 shuo1 xia1 hua4

definition: to lie through one's teeth (idiom)/to talk drivel
to fool around/to mess with/to do sth without a plan
to boast/to shoot one's mouth off

blind people touch an elephant (idiom, from Nirvana sutra 大般涅槃經|大般涅盘经[da4 ban1 Nie4 pan2 jing1]); fig. unable to see the big picture/to mistake the part for the whole/unable to see the wood for the trees

sentences.english: Not for him the rough and tumble of the financial marketplace.
sentences.chinese: 当然他也不会在金融市场里瞎搅和。

sentences.english: “Get you some wasp spray, ” she says. “It’ll put their eyes out.”
sentences.chinese: “你去搞罐杀虫喷雾剂，”她说，“喷瞎他们。”

sentences.english: She dreamed of turning a deaf-blind creature into a useful human.
sentences.chinese: 她梦想把一个既聋又瞎的人变成一个有用的人。

sentences.english: You will break the TV if you don't stop monkeying about with it.
sentences.chinese: 你这样瞎弄，要把电视机弄坏的。

sentences.english: This is one man I'd gladly help support by PAYING HIM to stop writing.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个值得你倒贴钱劝他别再瞎写的作家。

sentences.english: You guys spent too abundance time hanging away.
sentences.chinese: 你们花太多具体时间瞎混了。

sentences.english: Stone eyes are blind eyes, thought Tyrion.
sentences.chinese: 石化的眼睛是瞎的，提利昂想。

sentences.english: Are you not blinded by such expressionless sirens?
sentences.chinese: 这些面无表情的水妖没有弄瞎你的双眼吗？

sentences.english: The unruly youths soon cleared off when they saw the policeman coming.
sentences.chinese: 这些瞎起哄的青年看到警察来了就迅速溜掉。

sentences.english: So every elderships don't worry about me, I would not be reasonless .
sentences.chinese: 所以长辈们请放心，我不会瞎跑。

sentences.english: My aunt was blind by then.
After him vomiting and being blinded for a few hours, he was fine!
sentences.chinese: 他大吐一气，眼睛瞎了几个小时之后，跟没事人一样。

sentences.english: And I touched his eyes, and they became blind.
sentences.chinese: 我触碰他的双眼，于是他便瞎了。

sentences.english: He lost an eye in the war.
sentences.chinese: 他在战争中瞎了一只眼睛。

sentences.english: "We shall no longer be running around following the other advanced economies," said Arin.
sentences.chinese: 他说，“我们不必再跟在其他发达经济体的后面瞎跑。

sentences.english: The dog was 17 years old, deaf, blind and prone to “accidents”.
sentences.chinese: 这只狗17岁了，又聋又瞎，随时会挂掉似的。

definition: to make a scene/to fool around/to behave foolishly
to talk drivel/to assert sth without a proper understanding or basis in fact/not to know what one is talking about
to fool around/to mess with/to do sth without a plan
to leave/to depart/to separate/to distinguish/to classify/other/another/don't ...!/to pin/to stick (sth) in
to make sb change their ways, opinions etc
to boast/to shoot one's mouth off
contraction of 不用[bu4 yong4]/need not/please don't
